Posted By: EisselsEnnui (3/15/2013 12:29:45 AM)

posts.post_content:
Made me buy 2 of these Decks when I really did not have the money and have BEEN TRYING to save up for Modern Masters, and failing Miserably >.<   
  
I seriously though needed to regain a playset of Hellriders because they are for much more than Standard or Modern for me. :P Sooo flavorful they will go in Many of my Red Decks for years to come. :)  
  
And even if he drops down to $6.99 value or less, the Hellrider in this box is the best deal you are going to get for a Hellrider, because it also comes with a foil [Sorin, Lord of Innistrad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin, Lord of Innistrad). :P

posts.post_content: I like the effect but it seems a bit worthless if you opponent field clears beforehand. Also I see a huge weakness to a burn spell deck as when you think about it Hellrider is only a 3/3. I like hound of grieslbrand myself mostly because of its undying ability lets you attack just a little more fearlessly.

posts.post_content: He's excellent in goblins. Just imagine, [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) comes out, suddenly you're dealing 6 damage a turn before you even assign blockers. Excellent.
posts.html:
He's excellent in goblins. Just imagine, Krenko, Mob Boss comes out, suddenly you're dealing 6 damage a turn before you even assign blockers. Excellent.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: NARFNra (6/14/2013 7:20:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Darksythe222  
It's not worthless if your opponent board wipes. That's the thing about haste. They don't get a blocker out until you've swung at least once.  
  
In the type of deck this guy was meant for, you don't need to worry about board wipes anyway. You play fast, small creatures and a ton of burn spells. If your opponent hopes to stop you with a board wipe, they will most likely lose to the volley of burn spells that they no longer have mana to counter.  
  
If your opponent plays something like [increasing devotion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=increasing devotion) with the intention of mass chump blocking all day, they will still take a ton of damage.  
  
Picture it as a [massive raid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=massive raid) to the face every time you attack. On top of that, you get a 3/3 with haste. It's awesome.
posts.html:
@Darksythe222
It's not worthless if your opponent board wipes. That's the thing about haste. They don't get a blocker out until you've swung at least once.

In the type of deck this guy was meant for, you don't need to worry about board wipes anyway. You play fast, small creatures and a ton of burn spells. If your opponent hopes to stop you with a board wipe, they will most likely lose to the volley of burn spells that they no longer have mana to counter.

If your opponent plays something like increasing devotion with the intention of mass chump blocking all day, they will still take a ton of damage.

Picture it as a massive raid to the face every time you attack. On top of that, you get a 3/3 with haste. It's awesome.
